title: Bug 6410: File unchanged but dirtied by code assist
description: When using code assist in a Java file, the file is marked as dirty even when no suggestions are provided. This behavior is incorrect and can be misleading.
OB: When using code assist without any available suggestions, the file is marked as dirty even though no changes have been made.
EB: If code assist has nothing to suggest, it should not mark the file as dirty.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open a Java file.
2. Place the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call. For example, consider "I" to be the cursor below:
   Object o = anotherObject.method(I);
3. Press Ctrl+Space to invoke code assist.
